basic.description: This course covers fundamental methods of epidemiology for statisticians. With a focus on identification of risk factors for disease, topics include exposure-disease association, design of cohort, matched and randomized studies; cross-sectional and longitudinal studies; statistical analysis of data arising from such studies, confounding, adjustment and causality; and evaluation of diagnostic and screening tests.
basic.subject: STA
basic.title: Epidemiology for Statisticians

extra.enrollment_requirement: Prerequisites: STA 5167 and STA 5327 or instructor permission.
